content: Disobedience Brings God’s Judgment
And my eyes a fountain of tears,
That I might weep day and night
For the slain of the daughter of my people!
Oh, that I had in the wilderness
A lodging place for travelers;
That I might leave my people,
And go from them!
For they  all adulterers,
An assembly of treacherous men.
Therefore thus says the  of hosts:
Who  the wise man who may understand this? And  to whom the mouth of the  has spoken, that he may declare it? Why does the land perish  burn up like a wilderness, so that no one can pass through?
And the  said, “Because they have forsaken My law which I set before them, and have not obeyed My voice, nor walked according to it,
but they have walked according to the dictates of their own hearts and after the Baals, which their fathers taught them,”
therefore thus says the  of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will feed them, this people, with wormwood, and give them water of gall to drink.
I will scatter them also among the Gentiles, whom neither they nor their fathers have known. And I will send a sword after them until I have consumed them.”
The People Mourn in Judgment
